episodes.name: The Last Watch
episodes.overview: A documentary chronicling the fantasy drama’s eighth and final season. British documentarian Jeanie Finlay was embedded on the series’ set during production of the final six episodes, and the footage she captured during that time delves deep into the mud and blood to reveal the tears and triumphs involved in the challenge of bringing the fantasy world of Westeros to life in the very real studios, fields and car-parks of Northern Ireland.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Children of the Forest, the First Men, and the Andals
episodes.overview: Bran Stark recounts the legends surrounding the mysterious Children of the Forest and their wars against the First Men and the Andals.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Age of Heroes
episodes.overview: Bran Stark recounts the stories of legendary figures of several of the seven independent kingdoms that existed prior to the War of Conquest.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Old Gods and the New
episodes.overview: Catelyn and Bran Stark discuss the worship of the Old Gods of the Forest and the Seven in Westeros.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The History of the Night's Watch (Jeor Mormont)
episodes.overview: Jeor Mormont discusses the earliest days, structure and duty of the Night's Watch.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The History of the Night's Watch (Maester Luwin)
episodes.overview: Maester Luwin details the steady decline that the Night's Watch has suffered with the passage of time.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The History of the Night's Watch (Tywin Lannister)
episodes.overview: Tywin Lannister mocks the faded glory of the Night's Watch and questions the need for the order.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Order of the Maesters
episodes.overview: Maester Luwin explains the role and function of the Order of Maesters in the Seven Kingdoms as well as studies aspiring Maesters undergo.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Valyria and the Dragons
episodes.overview: Viserys Targaryen recounts the history of Valyria from its rise to becoming the greatest civilization the world has ever seen to its destruction in the Doom.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Field of Fire (Viserys Targaryen)
episodes.overview: Viserys Targaryen reflects on the victory which secured Aegon I Targaryen's domination of the Seven Kingdoms.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Field of Fire (Robb Stark)
episodes.overview: Robb Stark recalls how Aegon the Conqueror forced the lords of Westeros into submission with his brutal victory on the Field of Fire.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Mad King Aerys (Robert Baratheon)
episodes.overview: Robert Baratheon reflects on the actions of King Aerys II Targaryen and his son Rhaegar leading to his rebellion.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Mad King Aerys (Maester Luwin)
episodes.overview: Maester Luwin looks back on Prince Rhaegar's capture of Lyanna Stark and the horrific injustice inflicted on House Stark by the Mad King Aerys.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Mad King Aerys (Tywin Lannister)
episodes.overview: Tywin Lannister reminisces on the collapse of his alliance with Aerys as the latter descended further and further into madness.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Robert Baratheon)
episodes.overview: Robert Baratheon reminisces on his glorious victories against the supporters of the Mad King Aerys II Targaryen.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Viserys Targaryen)
episodes.overview: Viserys Targaryen bitterly recalls the treachery of the Usurper Robert Baratheon putting an end to the Targaryen dynasty.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Viserys Targaryen)
episodes.overview: Viserys Targaryen bitterly recounts Tywin Lannister's treachery bringing down the Targaryen dynasty.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Robert Baratheon)
episodes.overview: Robert Baratheon reflects on his victory over the Targaryen dynasty and the necessity for the death of Rhaegar Targaryen's children.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Maester Luwin)
episodes.overview: Maester Luwin details the downfall of the Mad King and the death of the royal family, as well as how it impacted those who won the war.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Sack of King's Landing (Tywin Lannister)
episodes.overview: Tywin Lannister reminisces on the part he played in defeating the Targaryens and the rewards his family reaped for it.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Stark
episodes.overview: Bran and Robb Stark discuss House Stark's reign as the Kings of Winter before kneeling to Aegon the Conqueror.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Lannister
episodes.overview: Tywin Lannister recalls how House Lannister survived and rose to prominence through cunning.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Targaryen
episodes.overview: Viserys Targaryen recounts the conquest of House Targaryen and its ruling of the Seven Kingdoms before being brought down by the treacherous Usurper Robert Baratheon.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Baratheon
episodes.overview: Robert Baratheon recalls the victories that led to House Baratheon cementing themselves as one of the greatest houses in Westeros.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Arryn
episodes.overview: Catelyn Stark speaks of the origins of House Arryn and the conquest of the Vale during the Andal Invasion and its role in Robert's Rebellion.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Robb Stark)
episodes.overview: Robb Stark reminisces about his father going to war to put an end to Balon Greyjoy's rebellion and the impact it had on his family.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Theon Greyjoy)
episodes.overview: Theon Greyjoy reflects on his father's failed rebellion and the penalties his family suffered as a result of it.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Stannis Baratheon)
episodes.overview: Stannis Baratheon recounts serving under his brother Robert when Balon Greyjoy rebelled against the Iron Throne, as well as how he would have done things differently had he been king.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Stannis Baratheon)
episodes.overview: Stannis Baratheon reflects on his brother Robert's rebellion against the Mad King Aerys II Targaryen and his own part in it, as well as his bitterness for not being justly rewarded.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Davos Seaworth)
episodes.overview: Davos Seaworth recounts his lowly beginnings and days as a smuggler as well as the event that brought him into the service of Stannis Baratheon.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Margaery Tyrell)
episodes.overview: Margaery Tyrell details House Tyrell's loyalty to House Targaryen before the rebellion and to House Baratheon afterwards.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Catelyn Stark)
episodes.overview: Catelyn Stark reminisces on the rebellion and how it affected the family she was born into as well as the one she married into.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Tyrell
episodes.overview: Margaery Tyrell details House Tyrell's history serving under House Gardener before the War of Conquest and House Targaryen afterwards, before surrendering to Robert Baratheon after he defeated the Targaryen dynasty.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Greyjoy
episodes.overview: Theon and Yara Greyjoy divulge the history of the ironborn and how House Greyjoy became the dominant family of the Iron Islands.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Clegane
episodes.overview: Sandor Clegane recounts House Clegane's humble beginnings, as well as how he and his brother Gregor became two of the most infamous killers in Westeros.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Free Folk
episodes.overview: Ygritte discusses the history and culture of the Free Folk in comparison to that of the inhabitants of the Seven Kingdoms.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Night's Watch
episodes.overview: Ygritte recites the history of the Night's Watch and their oppression of the Free Folk.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Dragonstone
episodes.overview: Stannis Baratheon recounts the history of the island Dragonstone, from the landing of the Targaryens to his own unwanted ruling of it.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Harrenhal
episodes.overview: Catelyn Stark details the rise and fall of the supposedly impenetrable fortress Harrenhal and the terrifying legends that have plagued its ruins ever since.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Free Cities
episodes.overview: Jorah Mormont explains the rise of the “Free Cities” of Essos in the wake of Valyria’s Doom, detailing how the cities differ and what one can expect to find in each one.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Qarth
episodes.overview: Xaro Xhoan Daxos explains Qarth’s role in Essos’ commerce, and how the merchant council known as the Thirteen rules the city to ensure it remains the greatest city that was or ever will be.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Drowned God
episodes.overview: Yara Greyjoy explains the worship of the Drowned God, His importance in the Iron Islands, and the legends of His halls beneath the waves.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Alchemists' Guild
episodes.overview: Wisdom Hallyne provides an account of the Alchemist Guild (or Pyromancers), detailing their knowledge of wildfire and how their once great influence in Westeros has faded over the years.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Warlocks
episodes.overview: Xaro Xhoan Daxos explains the mysterious order of the warlocks and their relationship with the House of the Undying, their center of power.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Old Ghis & Slaver's Bay
episodes.overview: Jorah Mormont charts the rise and fall of the Ghiscari Empire, including its battles with the Valyrian Freehold and the slaver cities that carry on in the wake of its destruction.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Unsullied
episodes.overview: Jorah Mormont recounts the legendary Battle of Qohor, in which three thousand Unsullied slave-warriors held off an entire Dothraki horde outside the gates of Qohor.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Reed
episodes.overview: Meera Reed discusses the history and modern perceptions of House Reed, leaders of the crannogmen, the mysterious swamp-dwelling gatekeepers of the North.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Bolton
episodes.overview: Roose Bolton discusses the history of House Bolton, one of the great houses of the North, despite their often unsavory reputation.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Frey
episodes.overview: Catelyn Stark tracks the House Frey’s quick rise to wealth and power through control of the Crossing, as well as their current reputation under the prickly and resentful Lord Walder Frey.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Tully
episodes.overview: Brynden Tully details the history of House Tully, the noble and diplomatic Lords Paramount of the Riverlands.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Lord of Light
episodes.overview: Thoros of Myr details his personal history as a follower of the Lord of Light, from his skeptical youth in Myr, to his visions in the flames that have made him a believer.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Wargs and the Sight
episodes.overview: Bran Stark explains the legendary abilities of warging and the Sight, skills that, although innate to the mythical Children of the Forest, only present themselves in modern men on rare occasion.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Petyr Baelish and Varys)
episodes.overview: Petyr Baelish and Varys debate the ramifications of Robert Baratheon’s rebellion against the Mad King Aerys II Targaryen, and its impact on the realm.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Red Keep
episodes.overview: Joffrey Baratheon reveals the history and structure of the Red Keep, the main fortress of King’s Landing, from its construction by the Targaryens, to its hidden lower dungeons.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The North
episodes.overview: Jon Snow describes the vast, cold and unforgiving North, which stretches from the Neck to the Wall, and has served as the barrier between the Seven Kingdoms and the horrors beyond the Wall for thousands of years.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Reach
episodes.overview: Margaery Tyrell discusses the history, customs, and noble houses of the Reach, the fertile region known for chivalry, knightly tournaments, farms, and vineyards.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Riverlands
episodes.overview: Brynden Tully recounts the history of the Riverlands, one of the most desirable-and most fought over-regions in the Seven Kingdoms.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Stormlands
episodes.overview: Brienne of Tarth recounts the tumultuous history of the Stormlands, from the constant battles waged by the Storm Kings, to the relative peace under Targaryen rule, to Robert’s Rebellion.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Westerlands
episodes.overview: Tywin Lannister reveals the history of the Westerlands, and the true strength behind the richest region of the Seven Kingdoms; House Lannister.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Vale
episodes.overview: Petyr Baelish delves into the history of the Vale, from its mythical beginnings to the impregnable Eyrie, the noble House Arryn, and the unpredictable Hill Tribes.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Martell
episodes.overview: Oberyn Martell discusses the history and reputation of House Martell, the strong-willed ruling family of Dorne that refused to join the Seven Kingdoms for centuries.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Baelish
episodes.overview: Petyr Baelish explains how, despite humble beginnings, House Baelish has rapidly risen to power, thanks mostly to his own wit and ambition.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Dragons
episodes.overview: Grand Maester Pycelle recounts the mysterious origins, magical powers, and inexplicable downfall of history's last generation of dragons.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Poisons
episodes.overview: Oberyn Martell explains the sources, surreptitious uses, and lethal effects of the many poisons circulating throughout Westeros and Essos.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Bastards of Westeros
episodes.overview: Ellaria Sand explains the shame cast upon bastards throughout much of Westeros, and how these unwanted children can tear families and kingdoms apart.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Iron Bank of Braavos
episodes.overview: Tycho Nestoris reveals the history behind the legendary Iron Bank of Braavos, an institution renowned for its economic power and formidable reputation.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Sellswords & Hedge Knights
episodes.overview: Bronn describes the unique profession and skill of the sellsword, as well as the debatable merits of the hedge knight.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Oberyn Martell)
episodes.overview: Oberyn Martell reveals the Dornish perspective of Robert's Rebellion - or the War of the Usurper as they call it - including the murder of his sister, Elia Martell, during the sack of King's Landing.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Wall
episodes.overview: Samwell Tarly explains the impressive construction and function of the Wall, including its natural defenses against wildling attempts to scale, breach, and circumnavigate it.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Nations of the North
episodes.overview: Tormund Giantsbane describes the varied clans of Free Folk living beyond the Wall, from Thenns to the Hornfoots to the Giants, all of whom Mance Rayder has rallied to his cause.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Kingsguard (Jaime Lannister)
episodes.overview: Jaime Lannister details the heroes and storied triumphs of the Kingsguard believed to be the most honorable knights in the realm.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Kingsguard (Bronn)
episodes.overview: Bronn sheds some light on the unfavorable moments from the Kingsguard's history, including their blind loyalty for less-than-honorable kings.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Maester's Chain
episodes.overview: Qyburn explains the significance of the Maester's Chain, a symbolic ornament earned by students of The Citadel, with each link representing the mastery of a different subject.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Death of Kings
episodes.overview: Varys tracks the lives and all too common deaths of the Kings of Westeros over the years, proving that the Iron Throne is truly an uncomfortable seat to hold.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Valyrian Steel
episodes.overview: Jorah Mormont details the mysterious properties of Valyrian Steel, a metal considered magical that was used to forge the blades of the great Houses of Westeros.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Justice of the Seven Kingdoms
episodes.overview: Bronn offers his view on the Seven Kingdoms' questionable methods of justice, including the dramatic trial by combat and the rarely invoked trial by Seven.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Seven-Pointed Star
episodes.overview: The High Sparrow details how "The Seven-Pointed Star" has influenced followers of the Faith of the Seven throughout the centuries.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Faith Militant
episodes.overview: The High Sparrow narrates the origins of the Faith Militant, its rebellion against House Targaryen that plunged the realm into war, and its ultimate decline and disbandment.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Volantis
episodes.overview: Varys discusses the history of Volantis, the oldest of the Free Cities from its humble beginnings as the first colony of Valyria.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Braavos
episodes.overview: Tycho Nestoris explains the history behind the beautiful city of Braavos, from the Titan who inhabits the harbor, to the world-renowned swordsmanship of the city's "bravos."

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Faceless Men
episodes.overview: Tycho Nestoris discusses the mysterious guild of assassins known as the Faceless Men.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Winterfell
episodes.overview: Roose Bolton gives his views on Winterfell and how the House Bolton influenced its creation and expansion before seizing it.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Lord Commanders
episodes.overview: Acting Lord Commander Alliser Thorne talks about the purpose of the Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, how he is chosen, and recalls some of the more noteworthy Lord Commanders, who made history through their folly.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Barristan Selmy)
episodes.overview: Barristan Selmy recounts how he was named to the Kingsguard, saw King Aerys descend into madness but revered Prince Rhaegar Targaryen. Barristan describes the fateful Tourney at Harrenhal, the ensuing War of the Five Kings, and how he fought beside Rhaegar at the Battle of the Trident where he was killed.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Dorne
episodes.overview: Ellaria Sand narrates a brief history of Dorne from the migration of the First Men to the present day.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Fighting Pits of Meereen
episodes.overview: Daario Naharis describes the history of the fighting pits of Meereen, the different types of fights that occur there, and the lives that the more-skilled fighters lead.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The River Rhoyne
episodes.overview: Varys talks about the Rhoyne, the largest river of Essos, and the people who originally inhabited it, the Rhoynar, and the war they fought against the Dragonlords.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Many-Faced God
episodes.overview: A man known as "Jaqen H'ghar" discusses the Many-Faced God, the syncretic god of death worshiped by the cult of assassins known as the Faceless Men.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Greyscale and the Stone Men
episodes.overview: Qyburn discusses the dreaded plague known as Greyscale, and its advanced victims known as "Stone Men".

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Great Masters of Meereen
episodes.overview: Missandei of Naath discusses the self-styled "Great Masters", the powerful aristocratic slaver families that rule over Meereen, the largest city in Slaver's Bay.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Dance of Dragons
episodes.overview: The great Targaryen civil war known as the Dance of the Dragons is discussed by Shireen Baratheon, Viserys Targaryen, Oberyn Martell, Robert Baratheon, Catelyn Stark, and Joffrey Baratheon.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Old Way
episodes.overview: Euron Greyjoy remembers the origins of the Old Way of the Ironborn in their days of glory, and how a brutal and bloody leader tried to recover it during the Dance of the Dragons.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Kingsmoot
episodes.overview: Euron Greyjoy discusses the origins of the tradition of the Kingsmoot, and he names the most famous and bloodthirsty kings named under this tradition.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Summer Sea
episodes.overview: Euron Greyjoy outlines the cultures and peoples he has witnessed in his travels and incursions for the Summer Sea.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The War of the Ninepenny Kings
episodes.overview: Brother Ray recounts the War of the Ninepenny Kings from the perspective of a peasant who was recruited by his Lord as a soldier, with all the sufferings and tragedies that this meant for his life.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Great Tourney at Harrenhal
episodes.overview: Meera Reed tells the story that her father told her during her childhood about the infamous tournament at Harrenhal, the biggest tournament in Westeros' history, in which a mysterious knight tested the honor of the great Lords.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Robert's Rebellion (Jaime Lannister)
episodes.overview: Jaime Lannister looks back on his appointment as a brother of the Kingsguard, with all the secret interests involved, and how it led to his infamous participation in the end of the Robert's Rebellion.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Vaes Dothrak
episodes.overview: Jorah Mormont explains the structure and places of interest of Vaes Dothrak, the vast capital of Dothraki people, and mentions some of the rituals practiced there by the Dosh khaleen.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Dothraki
episodes.overview: Jorah Mormont details the history of the first major migration of the Dothraki after the Doom of Valyria towards Central Essos, and how the newly invaded invaders destroyed the civilizations of what would later become the Dothraki Sea.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Northern Allegiances to House Stark
episodes.overview: Sansa Stark recounts the history of the North, of how it was once unified by the House Stark, of how its principal noble houses swore loyalty to them, and how they guaranteed its independence from the Andals, while she prepares herself from the Wall to confront those who now govern it.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Children of the Forest vs. the First Men
episodes.overview: The Three-Eyed Raven recounts the wars between the Children of the Forest and the First Men, and how they led to the conflict now threatening Westeros.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Brotherhood Without Banners
episodes.overview: Thoros of Myr explains the origin that led to the conformation of the Brotherhood Without Banners, and how it assumed the mission of protecting the smallfolk.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Oldtown
episodes.overview: Grand Maester Pycelle and Qyburn debate the records and theories about the history of Oldtown, the oldest city of Westeros, the noble house that governs it and the Citadel, the refuge and home of the noble order of the Maesters

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Dayne
episodes.overview: The young Eddard Stark recounts the history of House Dayne, the former kings and lords of Starfall, and how they have been linked to their legendary sword Dawn, especially his last and greatest bearer, Arthur Dayne, the Sword of the Morning.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Little Birds
episodes.overview: Varys recounts his own origins, and how he created his network of spies he calls his little birds.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Knights of the Vale
episodes.overview: Petyr Baelish highlights on arrival at the first of the Andals invaders who went on to become the great knights of the Vale of Arryn.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: House Tarly
episodes.overview: Randyll Tarly reflects on the history of House Tarly, and his own story with his eldest son Samwell.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Riverrun
episodes.overview: Brynden Tully details the history of Riverrun, the ancestral castle of the House Tully , and the strengths that have allowed it to resist millennia of wars.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Great Sept of Baelor
episodes.overview: The High Sparrow recounts the history of the Great Sept of Baelor, the largest Sept of the Faith of the Seven, and the pious King who built it, Baelor the Blessed.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Dragonpit
episodes.overview: Varys and Qyburn recall the era when Targaryen dragons were housed in King's Landing.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Citadel
episodes.overview: Samwell Tarly tells the history of the Citadel, the center of learning where maesters earn their chains.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Casterly Rock
episodes.overview: Jaime Lannister recounts the founding of his ancestral home, Casterly Rock.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Highgarden
episodes.overview: Randyll Tarly describes the battles, marriages, and alliances surrounding Highgarden, the seat of House Tyrell.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Golden Company
episodes.overview: Jorah Mormont explains the history of the Golden Company - a band of mercenaries who have built their reputation on never having lost a battle.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Prophecies of the Known World
episodes.overview: Samwell Tarly enumerates on the roles prophecies play in Westeros and Essos alike.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Hand of the King
episodes.overview: Petyr Baelish details the successes and failures of past Hands of the King.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Rains of Castamere
episodes.overview: Jaime Lannister provides the gruesome backstory surrounding "The Rains of Castamere."

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: King's Landing
episodes.overview: Varys explains the origins and the workings of King's Landing.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Greyjoy Rebellion (Jaime Lannister and Euron Greyjoy)
episodes.overview: Jaime Lannister and Euron Greyjoy argue their perspectives of the Greyjoy Rebellion.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Blackfyres
episodes.overview: Varys explains the backstory of House Blackfyre.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The South
episodes.overview: Tormund shares the Free Folks' perspective of Westeros south of The Wall and its inhabitants.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: The Defiance of Duskendale
episodes.overview: Varys explains the details of the Defiance of Duskendale and how this event forever changed Aerys II Targaryen for the worse.

episodes.name: Histories & Lore: Maegor the Cruel
episodes.overview: Varys recounts the terrifying history of Maegor Targaryen, also known as "Maegor the Cruel".

episodes.name: The Real History Behind Game of Thrones (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Watch historians, along with George R. R. Martin, explore the interweaving inspirations of the actual players in the era known as "The Wars of the Roses" and other historical events in this two-part series.

episodes.name: The Real History Behind Game of Thrones (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Watch historians, along with George R. R. Martin, explore the interweaving inspirations of the actual players in the era known as "The Wars of the Roses" and other historical events in this two-part series.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview: Trouble is brewing in the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros. For the driven inhabitants of this visionary world, control of Westeros' Iron Throne holds the lure of great power. But in a land where the seasons can last a lifetime, winter is coming...and beyond the Great Wall that protects them, an ancient evil has returned. In Season One, the story centers on three primary areas: the Stark and the Lannister families, whose designs on controlling the throne threaten a tenuous peace; the dragon princess Daenerys, heir to the former dynasty, who waits just over the Narrow Sea with her malevolent brother Viserys; and the Great Wall--a massive barrier of ice where a forgotten danger is stirring.

episodes.name: Winter Is Coming
episodes.overview: Jon Arryn, the Hand of the King, is dead. King Robert Baratheon plans to ask his oldest friend, Eddard Stark, to take Jon's place. Across the sea, Viserys Targaryen plans to wed his sister to a nomadic warlord in exchange for an army.

episodes.name: The Kingsroad
episodes.overview: While Bran recovers from his fall, Ned takes only his daughters to Kings Landing. Jon Snow goes with his uncle Benjen to The Wall. Tyrion joins them.

episodes.name: Lord Snow
episodes.overview: Lord Stark and his daughters arrive at King's Landing to discover the intrigues of the king's realm.

episodes.name: Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
episodes.overview: Eddard investigates Jon Arryn's murder. Jon befriends Samwell Tarly, a coward who has come to join the Night's Watch.

episodes.name: The Wolf and the Lion
episodes.overview: Catelyn has captured Tyrion and plans to bring him to her sister, Lysa Arryn, at The Vale, to be tried for his, supposed, crimes against Bran. Robert plans to have Daenerys killed, but Eddard refuses to be a part of it and quits.

episodes.name: A Golden Crown
episodes.overview: While recovering from his battle with Jamie, Eddard is forced to run the kingdom while Robert goes hunting. Tyrion demands a trial by combat for his freedom. Viserys is losing his patience with Drogo.

episodes.name: You Win or You Die
episodes.overview: Robert has been injured while hunting and is dying. Jon and the others finally take their vows to the Night's Watch. A man, sent by Robert, is captured for trying to poison Daenerys. Furious, Drogo vows to attack the Seven Kingdoms.

episodes.name: The Pointy End
episodes.overview: Eddard and his men are betrayed and captured by the Lannisters. When word reaches Robb, he plans to go to war to rescue them. The White Walkers attack The Wall. Tyrion returns to his father with some new friends.

episodes.name: Baelor
episodes.overview: Robb goes to war against the Lannisters. Jon finds himself struggling on deciding if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Drogo has fallen ill from a fresh battle wound. Daenerys is desperate to save him.

episodes.name: Fire and Blood
episodes.overview: With Ned dead, Robb vows to get revenge on the Lannisters. Jon must officially decide if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Daenerys says her final goodbye to Drogo.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: The cold winds of winter are rising in Westeros...war is coming...and five kings continue their savage quest for control of the all-powerful Iron Throne. With winter fast approaching, the coveted Iron Throne is occupied by the cruel Joffrey, counseled by his conniving mother Cersei and uncle Tyrion. But the Lannister hold on the Throne is under assault on many fronts. Meanwhile, a new leader is rising among the wildings outside the Great Wall, adding new perils for Jon Snow and the order of the Night's Watch.

episodes.name: The North Remembers
episodes.overview: As Robb Stark and his northern army continue the war against the Lannisters, Tyrion arrives in King’s Landing to counsel Joffrey and temper the young king’s excesses.  On the island of Dragonstone, Stannis Baratheon plots an invasion to claim his late brother’s throne, allying himself with the fiery Melisandre, a strange priestess of a stranger god.  Across the sea, Daenerys, her three young dragons, and the khalasar trek through the Red Waste in search of allies, or water.  In the North, Bran presides over a threadbare Winterfell, while beyond the Wall, Jon Snow and the Night’s Watch must shelter with a devious wildling.

episodes.name: The Night Lands
episodes.overview: In the wake of a bloody purge in the capital, Tyrion chastens Cersei for alienating the king’s subjects.  On the road north, Arya shares a secret with Gendry, a Night’s Watch recruit.  With supplies dwindling, one of Dany’s scouts returns with news of their position.  After nine years as a Stark ward, Theon Greyjoy reunites with his father Balon, who wants to restore the ancient Kingdom of the Iron Islands.  Davos enlists Salladhor Saan, a pirate, to join forces with Stannis and Melisandre for a naval invasion of King’s Landing.

episodes.name: What is Dead May Never Die
episodes.overview: At the Red Keep, Tyrion plots three alliances through the promise of marriage.  Catelyn arrives in the Stormlands to forge an alliance of her own, but King Renly, his new wife Margaery, and her brother Loras Tyrell have other plans.  At Winterfell, Luwin tries to decipher Bran’s dreams.

episodes.name: Garden of Bones
episodes.overview: Joffrey punishes Sansa for Robb’s victories, and Tyrion scrambles to temper the king’s cruelty. Catelyn entreats Stannis and Renly to unite against the Lannisters. Dany and her khalasar arrive at the prosperous city of Qarth. Tyrion coerces a relative into being his eyes and ears. Arya and Gendry are taken to Harrenhal, where their lives are in the hands of Ser Gregor Clegane. Stannis orders Davos to smuggle Melisandre into a secret cove.

episodes.name: The Ghost of Harrenhal
episodes.overview: The Baratheon rivalry ends, driving Catelyn to flee and Littlefinger to act. At King’s Landing, Tyrion’s source alerts him to Joffrey’s defense plan - and a mysterious secret weapon. Theon sails to the Stony Shore to prove he’s worthy to be called Ironborn. At Harrenhal, Arya receives a promise from Jaqen H’ghar, one of the prisoners she saved from the Gold Cloaks. The Night’s Watch arrive at the Fist of the First Men, an ancient ringfort where they hope to stem the wildings' advance.

episodes.name: The Old Gods and the New
episodes.overview: Theon completes his master stroke. In King's Landing, the Lannisters send Myrcella off to be married. Arya comes face to face with a surprise visitor. Dany vows to take what is hers. Robb and Catelyn receive crucial news. Qhorin gives Jon a chance to prove himself.

episodes.name: A Man Without Honor
episodes.overview: Jamie meets a distant relative. Daenerys receives an invitation to the House of the Undying. Theon leads a search party. Jon loses his way in the wilderness. Cersei counsels Sansa.

episodes.name: The Prince of Winterfell
episodes.overview: Theon receives a visitor. Arya asks her third and last death from Jaqen. While Stannis' army is reaching its destination, Davos is offered a reward.  Betrayal befalls Robb.

episodes.name: Blackwater
episodes.overview: Tyrion and the Lannisters fight for their lives as Stannis’ fleet assaults King’s Landing.

episodes.name: Valar Morghulis
episodes.overview: Tyrion awakens to a changed situation. King Joffrey doles out rewards to his subjects. As Theon stirs his men to action, Luwin offers some final advice. Brienne silences Jaime. Arya receives a gift from Jaqen. Dany goes to a strange place. Jon proves himself to Qhorin.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: Duplicity and treachery...nobility and honor...conquest and triumph...and, of course, dragons. In Season 3, family and loyalty are the overarching themes as many critical storylines from the first two seasons come to a brutal head. Meanwhile, the Lannisters maintain their hold on King's Landing, though stirrings in the North threaten to alter the balance of power; Robb Stark, King of the North, faces a major calamity as he tries to build on his victories; a massive army of wildlings led by Mance Rayder march for the Wall; and Daenerys Targaryen--reunited with her dragons--attempts to raise an army in her quest for the Iron Throne.

episodes.name: Valar Dohaeris
episodes.overview: Jon meets the King-Beyond-the-Wall while his Night Watch Brothers flee south. In King's Landing, Tyrion wants a reward, Margaery shows her charitable nature, Cersei arranges a dinner party, and Littlefinger offers to help Sansa. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys starts her journey west.

episodes.name: Dark Wings, Dark Words
episodes.overview: Sansa says too much. Shae asks Tyrion for a favor. Jaime finds a way to pass the time, while Arya encounters the Brotherhood Without Banners.

episodes.name: Walk of Punishment
episodes.overview: Tyrion shoulders new responsibilities. Jon is taken to the Fist of the First Men. Daenerys meets with the slavers. Jaime strikes a deal with his captors.

episodes.name: And Now His Watch Is Ended
episodes.overview: Trouble brews among the Night's Watch at Craster's. Margaery takes Joffrey out of his comfort zone. Arya meets the leader of the Brotherhood. Varys plots revenge on an old foe. Theon mournfully recalls his missteps. Daenerys deftly orchestrates her exit from Astapor.

episodes.name: Kissed by Fire
episodes.overview: The Hound is judged by the gods. Jaime is judged by men. Jon proves himself. Robb is betrayed. Tyrion learns the cost of weddings.

episodes.name: The Climb
episodes.overview: Tywin plans strategic unions for the Lannisters. Melisandre pays a visit to the Riverlands. Robb weighs a compromise to repair his alliance with House Frey. Roose Bolton decides what to do with Jaime Lannister. Jon, Ygritte, and the Wildlings face a daunting climb.

episodes.name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
episodes.overview: Daenerys exchanges gifts with a slave lord outside of Yunkai. As Sansa frets about her prospects, Shae chafes at Tyrion’s new situation. Tywin counsels the king, and Melisandre reveals a secret to Gendry. Brienne faces a formidable foe in Harrenhal.

episodes.name: Second Sons
episodes.overview: King’s Landing hosts a wedding, and Tyrion and Sansa spend the night together. Daenerys meets the Titan’s Bastard. Davos demands proof from Melisandre. Sam and Gilly meet an older gentleman.

episodes.name: The Rains of Castamere
episodes.overview: Robb presents himself to Walder Frey, and Edmure meets his bride. Jon faces his harshest test yet. Bran discovers a new gift. Daario and Jorah debate how to take Yunkai. House Frey joins with House Tully.

episodes.name: Mhysa
episodes.overview: Joffrey challenges Tywin. Bran tells a ghost story. In Dragonstone, mercy comes from strange quarters. Daenerys waits to see if she is a conqueror or a liberator.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview: The War of the Five Kings is drawing to a close, but new intrigues and plots are in motion, and the surviving factions must contend with enemies not only outside their ranks, but within.

episodes.name: Two Swords
episodes.overview: Tyrion welcomes a guest to King’s Landing. At Castle Black, Jon Snow finds himself unwelcome. Dany is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya runs into an old friend.

episodes.name: The Lion and the Rose
episodes.overview: Tyrion lends Jaime a hand. Joffrey and Margaery host a breakfast. At Dragonstone, Stannis loses patience with Davos. Ramsay finds a purpose for his pet. North of the Wall, Bran sees where they must go.

episodes.name: Breaker of Chains
episodes.overview: Tyrion ponders his options. Tywin extends an olive branch. Sam realizes Castle Black isn’t safe, and Jon proposes a bold plan. The Hound teaches Arya the way things are. Dany chooses her champion.

episodes.name: Oathkeeper
episodes.overview: Dany balances justice and mercy. Jaime tasks Brienne with his honor. Jon secures volunteers while Bran, Jojen, Meera and Hodor stumble on shelter.

episodes.name: First of His Name
episodes.overview: Cersei and Tywin plan the Crown's next move; Dany discusses future plans; Jon Snow begins a new mission.

episodes.name: The Laws of Gods and Men
episodes.overview: Stannis and Davos set sail; Dany meets with supplicants; Tyrion faces down his father.

episodes.name: Mockingbird
episodes.overview: Tyrion gains an unlikely ally; Daario asks Dany to allow him to do what he does best; Jon's warnings about the vulnerability of the Wall are ignored; Brienne follows a new lead.

episodes.name: The Mountain and the Viper
episodes.overview: Unexpected visitors arrive in Mole's Town. Littlefinger's motives are questioned. Ramsay tries to prove himself to his father. Tyrion's fate is decided.

episodes.name: The Watchers on the Wall
episodes.overview: Jon Snow and the Night's Watch face a big challenge.

episodes.name: The Children
episodes.overview: Circumstances change after an unexpected arrival from north of the Wall. Dany must face harsh realities. Bran learns more about his destiny. Tyrion sees the truth about his situation.

seasons.name: Season 5
seasons.overview: The War of the Five Kings, once thought to be drawing to a close, is instead entering a new and more chaotic phase. Westeros is on the brink of collapse, and many are seizing what they can while the realm implodes, like a corpse making a feast for crows.

episodes.name: The Wars to Come
episodes.overview: Cersei and Jaime adjust to a world without Tywin. Varys reveals a conspiracy to Tyrion. Dany faces a new threat to her rule. Jon is caught between two kings.

episodes.name: The House of Black and White
episodes.overview: Arya arrives in Braavos. Podrick and Brienne run into trouble on the road. Cersei fears for her daughter's safety in Dorne as Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death. Stannis tempts Jon. An adviser tempts Daenerys.

episodes.name: High Sparrow
episodes.overview: In Braavos, Arya sees the Many-Faced God. In King's Landing, Queen Margaery enjoys her new husband. Tyrion and Varys walk the Long Bridge of Volantis.

episodes.name: Sons of the Harpy
episodes.overview: The Faith Militant grow increasingly aggressive. Jaime and Bronn head south. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes vow vengeance.

episodes.name: Kill the Boy
episodes.overview: Dany makes a difficult decision in Meereen. Jon recruits the help of an unexpected ally. Brienne searches for Sansa. Theon remains under Ramsay's control.

episodes.name: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
episodes.overview: Arya trains. Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers. Trystane and Myrcella make plans. Jaime and Bronn reach their destination. The Sand Snakes attack.

episodes.name: The Gift
episodes.overview: Jon prepares for conflict. Sansa tries to talk to Theon. Brienne waits for a sign. Stannis remains stubborn. Jaime attempts to reconnect with family.

episodes.name: Hardhome
episodes.overview: Arya makes progress in her training. Sansa confronts an old friend. Cersei struggles. Jon travels.

episodes.name: The Dance of Dragons
episodes.overview: Stannis confronts a troubling decision. Jon returns to The Wall. Mace visits the Iron Bank. Arya encounters someone from her past. Dany reluctantly oversees a traditional celebration of athleticism.

episodes.name: Mother's Mercy
episodes.overview: Stannis marches. Dany is surrounded by strangers. Cersei seeks forgiveness. Jon is challenged.

seasons.name: Season 6
seasons.overview: Following the shocking developments at the conclusion of season five, survivors from all parts of Westeros and Essos regroup to press forward, inexorably, towards their uncertain individual fates. Familiar faces will forge new alliances to bolster their strategic chances at survival, while new characters will emerge to challenge the balance of power in the east, west, north and south.

episodes.name: The Red Woman
episodes.overview: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Daenerys meets a strong man. Cersei sees her daughter once again.

episodes.name: Home
episodes.overview: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. In King’s Landing, Jaime advises Tommen. Tyrion demands good news, but has to make his own. At Castle Black, the Night’s Watch stands behind Thorne. Ramsay Bolton proposes a plan, and Balon Greyjoy entertains other proposals.

episodes.name: Oathbreaker
episodes.overview: Daenerys meets her future. Bran meets the past. Tommen confronts the High Sparrow. Arya trains to be No One. Varys finds an answer. Ramsay gets a gift.

episodes.name: Book of the Stranger
episodes.overview: Tyrion strikes a deal. Jorah and Daario undertake a difficult task. Jaime and Cersei try to improve their situation.

episodes.name: The Door
episodes.overview: Tyrion seeks a strange ally. Bran learns a great deal. Brienne goes on a mission. Arya is given a chance to prove herself.

episodes.name: Blood of My Blood
episodes.overview: An old foe comes back into the picture. Gilly meets Sam’s family. Arya faces a difficult choice. Jaime faces off against the High Sparrow.

episodes.name: The Broken Man
episodes.overview: The High Sparrow eyes another target. Jaime confronts a hero. Arya makes a plan. The North is reminded.

episodes.name: No One
episodes.overview: While Jaime weighs his options, Cersei answers a request. Tyrion's plans bear fruit. Arya faces a new test.

episodes.name: Battle of the Bastards
episodes.overview: As the Starks prepare to fight, Davos loses something dear. Ramsay plays a game. Daenerys faces a choice.

episodes.name: The Winds of Winter
episodes.overview: Tyrion counsels Daenerys on the upcoming campaign. Jon and Sansa discuss their future. Trials begin in King's Landing.

seasons.name: Season 7
seasons.overview: The long winter is here. And with it comes a convergence of armies and attitudes that have been brewing for years.

episodes.name: Dragonstone
episodes.overview: Jon organizes the defense of the North. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home.

episodes.name: Stormborn
episodes.overview: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces a revolt. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros.

episodes.name: The Queen's Justice
episodes.overview: Daenerys holds court. Tyrion backchannels. Cersei returns a gift. Jaime learns from his mistakes.

episodes.name: The Spoils of War
episodes.overview: Daenerys fights back. Jaime faces an unexpected situation. Arya comes home.

episodes.name: Eastwatch
episodes.overview: Tyrion tries to find a way to make Daenerys listen to reason while Jon plans a dangerous new mission.

episodes.name: Beyond the Wall
episodes.overview: Jon and his team go beyond the wall to capture a wight. Daenerys has to make a tough decision.

episodes.name: The Dragon and the Wolf
episodes.overview: A meeting is held in King's Landing. Problems arise in the North.

seasons.name: Season 8
seasons.overview: The Great War has come, the Wall has fallen and the Night King's army of the dead marches towards Westeros. The end is here, but who will take the Iron Throne?

episodes.name: Winterfell
episodes.overview: Arriving at Winterfell, Jon and Daenerys struggle to unite a divided North. Jon Snow gets some big news.

episodes.name: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
episodes.overview: The battle at Winterfell is approaching. Jaime is confronted with the consequences of the past. A tense interaction between Sansa and Daenerys follows.

episodes.name: The Long Night
episodes.overview: The Night King and his army have arrived at Winterfell and the great battle begins. Arya looks to prove her worth as a fighter.

episodes.name: The Last of the Starks
episodes.overview: In the wake of a costly victory, Jon and Daenerys look to the south as Tyrion eyes a compromise that could save countless lives.

episodes.name: The Bells
episodes.overview: Daenerys brings her forces to King's Landing.

episodes.name: The Iron Throne
episodes.overview: In the aftermath of the devastating attack on King's Landing, Daenerys must face the survivors.
